definition: to sound (old, foreign, exciting, right etc)/to ring (true)/to sound as if (i.e. to give the listener an impression)/to hear from somewhere
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.chinese: 这消息我是间接听来的。

sentences.english: There was an audible stillness. in which the common voice sounded strange.
sentences.chinese: 四周一片听的见的寂静，连平常的声音听来也觉异样。

sentences.english: He began to breathe at last, but his voice was unsteady.
sentences.chinese: 他终于开始吸上一口气，但他的声音听来颤颤微微的。

sentences.english: It fell with a leaden weight on isabel's ears .
sentences.chinese: 这在伊莎贝尔听来象铅块一样沉重。

sentences.english: It sounded both familiar and exotic, feminine yet strong.
sentences.chinese: 听来情切又不失异国风情，柔情似水又坚强有力。

sentences.english: We live a cute life, soundfematic.
sentences.chinese: 我有个可爱的人生，听来很娘。

sentences.english: His excuse about the train being late doesn't ring true to me.
sentences.chinese: 他推说是火车误点了，这话听来不真实。

sentences.english: The song ever and very liked. Can always let me remind of youth and love…
sentences.chinese: 这歌曾经很喜欢，听来能让我们想起年青和爱情。
这一判断听来是刺耳的。

sentences.english: Where did you hear the joke?
sentences.chinese: 你是从哪儿听来的笑话？

sentences.english: He was starting to sound upset again.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听来又有些心烦了。

sentences.english: Yes, I am sure, I heard it from Prof. Mcgonagall.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我确定，我从麦格教授那儿听来的。

sentences.english: He said some really off –the-wall things. Where does he come up with them?
sentences.chinese: 他说了一些非常离奇的事。他从那里听来的？

sentences.english: The offer was complimentary. Also, it had its temptations.
sentences.chinese: 这个提议听来很是顺耳，且又不无诱惑。

sentences.english: Canadian English is music to my ears, not like American English.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大英语在我的耳朵听来是音乐，不像美国英语。

sentences.english: He said some really off – the-wall things. Where does he come up with thp em?
sentences.chinese: 他说了一些非常离奇的事。他从那里听来的？

definition: pleasant to hear (i.e. agreeable news)/to one's liking/music to one's ears/Taiwan pr. [zhong4 ting1]
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to speak in a pleasant and captivating manner (idiom)
